title: St. Regis
content:
Here´s a nice one but what is it? Thankfull for all the help I can get.  
P

 [‹ Brush Script - Utz Kettle Cooked](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28490 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Helvetica? ID Please ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28489 "Go to next forum topic")
author: plojel

comments.content: Yes, close but no hare. As we say in Sweden

Looks to me like someone took an existing solid font and manipulated it in Photoshop..

ChrisL

I agree that it seems at least customized, if not custom lettering. I have sent an e-mail to their corporate office asking about the logo typeface, since I was unable to find a match for it in any place I looked. Maybe that’s how we’ll get your ’hare’.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you for your help Mike. Im really curious about their response to your e-mail.

“Openface” or “handtooled” fonts you might enjoy.

ChrisL

Don’t forget the queen of inlines, Cristal.

Chris, you two are just too cute.

hhp
